post.content:
This piece of code shows how to parse dates from their string representations. It uses a SimpleDateFormat object to parse a string and return a Date object. The way to do this is to first tell SimpleDateFormat how the date is represented as a string. In the code extract below, the pattern is specified in the constructor, but one could also specify it by using the applyPattern(String pattern) method.


import java.util.Date;
import java.text.ParseException;
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;

public class TestDate {

        public static void main(String[] args) throws ParseException {
                String s = "15-05-2005 5:55:55";

                SimpleDateFormat df = new SimpleDateFormat("dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss");
                Date date = df.parse(s);

                System.out.println(date);
        }
}
post.title: Parsing Dates from String Values
